DataElement.preferredName: Chimerism Laboratory Procedure Performed Hematopoietic Stem Cell Tissue Donor Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the hematopoietic stem cell tissue donor for the chimerism laboratory procedure that was performed..

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual.:A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.

Concepts.definition: The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Tissue Donor Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: National Marrow Donor Program Legal Adult Donor

ValueMeaning.preferredName: National Marrow Donor Program Legal Adult Donor
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need.: A person of legal age to consent to a procedure as specifed by local regulation.: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants and cellular therapies for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need.
A person of legal age to consent to a procedure as specifed by local regulation.
Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: National Marrow Donor Program Umbilical Cord Blood Unit

ValueMeaning.preferredName: National Marrow Donor Program Umbilical Cord Blood Unit
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need.: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.: Any division of quantity accepted as a standard of measurement or exchange.

Concepts.definition: A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants and cellular therapies for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need.

Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.
A single undivided thing occurring in the composition of something else.
